revision.comment: /* Life and career */Fixed birthplace.. As per Robin Dukes Twitter feed
revision.text:
{{Too short|date=March 2018}} {{Infobox person | name = Robin Duke | image = | caption = | birth_name = | birth_date = {{birth date and age |1954|03|13}} | birth_place = [[St. Catharines]], [[Ontario]], Canada | occupation = Actress, comedian | years_active = | spouse = Hendrik Riik | children = 1 }}
'''Robin Duke''' (born March 13, 1954) is a Canadian [[actress]], [[comedian]], and [[voice actress]]. Duke may be best known for her work on the television comedy series ''[[Second City Television|SCTV]]'' and, later, ''[[Saturday Night Live]]''. She co-founded ''Women Fully Clothed'', a sketch comedy troupe which toured Canada. She teaches writing as a faculty member at [[Humber College]] in [[Toronto]] and has a recurring role playing Wendy Kurtz in the sitcom ''[[Schitt's Creek]]''.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://creativearts.humber.ca/faculty/robin-duke.html |title=Robin Duke Biography |publisher=[[Humber College]] |access-date=October 30, 2017}}</ref>
==Life and career== Duke was born in [[Toronto]], [[Ontario]].<ref>{{cite web|last1=Wright|first1=Megh|title=Saturday Night's Children|url=http://splitsider.com/2012/04/saturday-nights-children-robin-duke-1981-1984/|website=[[Splitsider]]}}</ref> She went to high school with [[Catherine O'Hara]] at [[Burnhamthorpe Collegiate Institute]] in Etobicoke; they first met in home room class. In 1976 Duke joined O'Hara as part of the Toronto version of the stage comedy troupe [[The Second City]], while also making several appearances in the troupe's television series, ''SCTV''. Duke became a regular on ''SCTV'' from 1980–81. She joined the cast of ''Saturday Night Live'' in 1981 when O'Hara suddenly dropped out of that show.
==='' NBC's Saturday Night Live (SNL)'' (1981–1984)=== Duke was an actress and writer on SNL from 1981 to 1984.<ref>{{cite book|last=Shales|first=Tom|author-link=Tom Shales|title=Live From New York: The Complete, Uncensored History of Saturday Night Live as Told by Its Stars, Writers, and Guests|date=2015|publisher=[[Back Bay Books]]|isbn=978-0316295062|page=184}}</ref> Duke was hired in place of Catherine O'Hara, who was chosen as a cast member when Dick Ebersol was hired following the termination of Jean Doumanian and most of her cast members. O'Hara backed out after ''SNL'' writer Michael O'Donoghue yelled at cast and crew members for ruining the show during its sixth season. Duke's most popular character was probably [[The Whiners|Wendy Whiner]], a woman who, with her equally whiny husband ([[Joe Piscopo]]), annoyed everyone she met.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://mentalfloss.com/article/50632/post-snl-careers-5-castmembers |title=The Post-SNL Careers of 5 Featured Players |first=Erik |last=van Rheenen |website=[[Mental Floss]] |date=May 18, 2013}}</ref> She is also remembered for appearing with [[Mr. T]] as the equally bizarre "Mrs. T" in a faux commercial for the real-life product "Mr. and Mrs. T's [[Bloody Mary (cocktail)|Bloody Mary]] Mix".
===Film acting credits=== Duke went on to appear in such films as ''[[Club Paradise]]'' (1986), ''[[Groundhog Day (film)|Groundhog Day]]'' (1993), ''[[Stuart Saves His Family]]'' (1995) and ''[[Portrait of a Serial Monogamist]]'' (2015), along with many television guest appearances.
===Voice-over acting credits=== Duke is also the voice of Penny in the children's animated television series ''[[George and Martha]]''. Her other voice roles include: *''[[Bob and Margaret]]'' *''[[Atomic Betty]]'' *''[[Marvin the Tap-Dancing Horse]]''
===''Women Fully Clothed'' (2004)=== In 2004, Duke along with [[Kathy Greenwood|Kathryn Greenwood]], [[Debra McGrath]], [[Jayne Eastwood]] and [[Teresa Pavlinek]] created [[Women Fully Clothed]], a sketch comedy troupe. The group has toured the United States, Canada and appeared in Scotland at the Edinburgh Festival.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.nowtoronto.com/stage/story.cfm?content=174868 |title=Women Fully Clothed: Older and Hotter |first=Glenn |last=Sumi |newspaper=[[Now (newspaper)|Now]] |date=May 6, 2010}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://beta.theglobeandmail.com/arts/theatre-and-performance/more-bladder-busting-laughs-from-women-fully-clothed-quartet/article629133/ |title=More bladder-busting laughs from Women Fully Clothed quartet |first=Brad |last=Wheeler |newspaper=[[The Globe and Mail]] |date=June 15, 2011}}</ref>
===''Schitt's Creek'' (2016)=== In 2016, Duke joined the cast of ''[[Schitt's Creek]]'' playing dress shop owner Wendy Kurtz. The sitcom reunites Duke with her old ''SCTV'' castmate [[Eugene Levy]].
